title: tamil nadu: Governor should invite Sasikala to form government in Tamil Nadu: Subramanian Swamy | India News - Times of India

organizations.name: subramanian swamy | india news - times of india governor

text: Governor should invite Sasikala to form government in Tamil Nadu: Subramanian Swamy Governor should invite Sasikala to form government in Tamil Nadu: Subramanian Swamy Senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Subramanian Swamy on Friday said that Governor Ch Vidyasagar Rao should ask AIADMK general secretary VK Sasikala to form government in Tamil Nadu. TNN & Agencies | Feb 10, 2017, 10.48 AM IST NEW DELHI: Senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Subramanian Swamy on Friday said that Governor Ch Vidyasagar Rao should ask AIADMK general secretary VK Sasikala to form government in Tamil Nadu . He also said that if the caretaker chief minister Pannerselvam withdraws his resignation, it will be like putting the toothpaste back in the tube. "Pannerselvam didn't give any list of lawmakers who are supporting him. He didn't stake any claim. He just wants his resignation to be withdrawn. But, it has already been accepted. How can he do this? It's like putting toothpaste back in the tube," Swamy was quoted as saying by ANI. #Sasikala gave list of MLAs, #Paneerselvam did not. She has majority. What is the Governor waiting for?: Subramanian Swamy,BJP pic.twitter.com/ZPXwTHsK35 â€” ANI (@ANI_news) February 10, 2017 Taking a jibe at the governor he said, "So, if the governor has any chance, and he has woken up to his duties as a constitutional authority, he should ask Sasikala to form a government and then move a resolution in the assembly for confidence vote and proceed from there." "There is now nothing left. Had Pannerselvam produced a list, there would have been a question over which list to accept. If the governor now doesn't call Sasikala, it would mean he is playing politics and he deserves to be removed," he added. On Thursday, Sasikala met Governor Vidyasagar Rao and handed him the letters of support given by her party legislators.
